label: 北条時宗
本: Jewel in the Ashes: Buddha Relics and Power in Early Medieval Japan . Harvard University Asia Center . 2000
説明文: Hōjō Tokimune (J.) 北条時宗, with the childhood name of 正寿 Masahisa, and commonly called 相模太郎 Sagami tarō; clerical name of 道杲 Dōgō. This son of Tokiyori (1227-63) rose to be shogunal regent in 1268 and was the leader of the forces sent to stop the Mongol threats of 1274 and 1281. He also had great interest in Zen, founding Engakuji in 1282.
